ygData.subject: The Evolutionary Origins of Hierarchy
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, As many of you know, for over a decade now we have been investigating how to promote the evolution of “structural organization” in networks,

Subject: The Evolutionary Origins of Hierarchy

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Hello all,

As many of you know, for over a decade now we have been investi=
gating how to promote the evolution of =E2=80=9Cstructural organization=E2=
=80=9D in networks, i.e. networks with regularity, modularity, and hierarch=
y. So far, we have published papers on the evolution of regularity (Clune e=
t al. 2011, Tonelli & Mouret, 2013, and others) and modularity (Clune, Mour=
et, & Lipson 2013, and others). 

I am pleased to offer our first major pap=
er on the evolution of hierarchy. 

http://arxiv.org/abs/1505.06353

In sho=
rt, we find that a connection cost promotes the evolution of hierarchy in a=
ddition to modularity, and that this hierarchy improves the ability to solv=
e hierarchical problems and promotes evolvability. 

I would like to especi=
ally congratulate and thank Evolving AI Lab Ph.D. student Henok Mengistu, w=
ho has worked extremely hard on this project for over two years now, and ha=
s done excellent work. 

As always, we look forward to hearing your thought=
s. Please fire away with questions!


Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Assistant P=
rofessor, Computer Science
Director, Evolving Artificial Intelligence Lab <=
http://evolvingai.org/>
University of Wyoming
jeffclune@...
jeffclune.=
com


--Apple-Mail=_C469D947-7B72-4795-A091-FA8D436DC726
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
